name: sojourned
content:

past simple and past participle of
sojourn
to spend a short period staying in a particular place: Winston Churchill and Francois Mitterrand have sojourned at this glorious former monastery. He must not sojourn in the house without entertainment.
More examplesFewer examplesIf they come to sojourn at my house, I will not be there.He collapsed in a bar in January and subsequently sojourned in intensive care. The stranger had sojourned in many lands.
